meanings.definition: The act of enrolling in a program or course before the official registration period.
meanings.sent1: Preenrollment is important for securing a spot in popular classes.
meanings.sent2: Students completed preenrollment to ensure they got the classes they wanted.
meanings.sent3: The early bird caught the worm by doing preenrollment for the sought-after course.
meanings.sent4: Her preenrollment strategy was like reserving a front-row seat at a concert.
meanings.sent5: The concept of preenrollment was like making a reservation at a busy restaurant.

meanings.definition: The process of signing up for classes or services in advance.
meanings.sent1: Before the semester started, students engaged in preenrollment to secure their schedules.
meanings.sent2: Preenrollment allowed students to plan their academic year ahead of time.
meanings.sent3: The preenrollment rush felt like a race to claim the best courses.
meanings.sent4: Her preenrollment experience was akin to booking tickets for a popular movie.
meanings.sent5: The convenience of preenrollment was like making a reservation at a busy restaurant.
